definition: to sit side-by-side and have a heart-to-heart talk (idiom)
to speak/to talk/to converse/to chat/to discuss

sentences.english: ShangMingYang father came to visit troops, both father and son a heart-to-heart talk.
sentences.chinese: 汤名扬的爸爸来到部队探望儿子，父子二人促膝谈心。

sentences.english: I got knee to knee with him.
Now that everyone else has gone, both of us can have a heart-to-heart talk.
sentences.chinese: 既然别人都走了，我们俩人可以促膝谈心。

sentences.english: This was the place for our tete-a-tete.
sentences.chinese: 这图书馆是我们促膝谈心的地方。

definition: lit. knees pressed close/intimate/seated side by side/in close contact
to talk or chat about ordinary daily life
to give one's bare heart into sb else's keeping (idiom); sb has one's absolute confidence/to trust completely/to confide in sb with entire sincerity
to enquire solicitously about sb's well-being (idiom)/to pamper
to talk endlessly/talking of anything under the sun
variant of 閒談|闲谈[xian2 tan2]
lit. to live and sleep together (idiom); fig. a close friendship
to have an in depth conversation/to have intimate talks/to discuss thoroughly
not to hold anything back (idiom)/(of close friends etc) to tell each other everything
